freelance photographer for National Geographic / Contact Press Images

posts.description: As we enter into the Passover weekend, just a reminder to check your local PBS station to see when Gefiltefish Chronicles, the award-winning documentary movie  will be broadcast in your area,  and which will make your weekend perfect.  #gefiltefishchronicles
"I coulda been a contender". A somewhat sorry, out of date, over the hill urinal in a somewhat sorry, over the hill hotel

Mark Carruthers has been doing a series called “One Frame”  Here is my contribution, my Holga image of Joe Wilson and Valerie Plame
http://tinyurl.com/m64lf56

Some of the 20x30 prints heading to "The Outsiders" Museum in Tulsa, OK for the late April opening. I was a "special photographer” on the set for this FF Coppola film (and a few months later on"Rumble Fish"). It's the 35th anniversary of the movie this May and the 50th anniversary of the famed S.E. Hinton book. We've got an amazing, rarely seen portfolio of my work on the set of this film which featured nearly every hot male (and female) star at the time - at the beginnings of their careers - and then some. So, who  wants to publish this fun story? CruiseSwayzeHowellEstevezDillonLoweMacchio

It was the winter of 2011-12, just five short years ago, when members of the Photographers for Hope, a small collective of dedicated photographers from as many countries as there are people, gathered in Dhaka to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the founding of Bangladesh.  I had been there in 1971 during the height of the Indo-Pakistan war, the end of which yielded a new country… what had been East Pakistan had finally thrown off rule from Islamabad, and created their own country, to the cries of “Joi Bangla!” (Those words still get a rise from Bangladeshi cab drivers in NYC…) Our photogs worked mainly in the area of civil and social development, creating pictures on pre-natal care, fresh water, and other issues facing both village and town life.  In a brick yard, there was a moment when one of the workers stopped, getting ready to take on his next load.  And I looked at his feet, feet which have carried him and his load for decades.  Pure strength in those feet.  Nothing fancy.  No Florsheims. No $150 Nikes.  Those feet have carried him and his burden all those years.  They are the pillars of his life.  @photographersForHope #4x5BW #SpeedGraphic

Last Saturday a large group of Jewish photographers gathered briefly with the noted and celebrated Robert Frank at his apartment in Greenwich Village just long enough for us to say thank you, and to make a few pictures #blackandwhite #SpeedGraphic

had to pick up some post cards today to publicize Gefilte Fish Chronicles (our documentary which will air on a LOT of local PBS stations around the country this April — call your local station and say you WANT to see GFC!!)… and while there, saw a pack of Staedler pencils in the *Specials* bin… they looked so cool.. brought them home, shot em with my GX7 and the 50mm Ektanon which redefines “macro” (the lens focus rings goes three full turns!)… i might even write a note with one of these pencils… but i might not.

Very happy to see that my picture of the Egyptian Syncho Swimming team won a 2nd (SptsFeat)in the annual Eyes of History competition run by the White House News Photographer’s Assn. This picture from my work for the I.O.C. in RIO 2016 Games.  There are some terrific pictures in this year’s contest…have a look: https://twitter.com/whnpa

This week marks what would have been Bob Marley’s 72nd birthday - he shares a birthday with my daughter Jordan Kai (and Ronald Reagan). I spent a short time with Bob in Jamaica in 1976 and a year later travelled with the him and the band on the Exodus tour.  This contact sheet was made during the interview at Tuffgong - and is available for sale as a fine art print (send Jeffrey Smith mail@contactpressimages.com a note!) One of the best subjects any photographer could have hoped for.  I wrote about it on Facebook…i think this works: https://www.facebook.com/dave.burnett.16/posts/10154971950853904

The lemonade, sipping slowly, while waiting for the main course and I do mean "main course" at Paul Smythe's Twisted Fried Chicken and Waffles on 9w ten minutes north of Newburgh NY.  I probably would have posted a picture of the chicken but my fingers were too messy after the first bite. Don't miss it- this place is a gift to the mid Hudson Valley
